meanings.definition: A person or thing that sustains or supports something.
meanings.sent1: The strong pillars in the building act as sustainers.
meanings.sent2: The bridge's cables are important sustainers of its structure.
meanings.sent3: The little ant thought it was the sustainer of the whole anthill.
meanings.sent4: Her encouraging words were the sustainers of his confidence.
meanings.sent5: The roots of the tree served as the vital sustainers of its growth.

meanings.definition: A device or system that provides power or support to something.
meanings.sent1: The solar panels on the roof are effective sustainers of energy.
meanings.sent2: The generator acts as a reliable sustainer during power outages.
meanings.sent3: The robot vacuum cleaner became the unexpected sustainer of cleanliness in the house.
meanings.sent4: The internet connection is the digital sustainer of our daily communication.
meanings.sent5: The water pump is a crucial sustainer of the farm's irrigation system.

meanings.definition: A group of people or organization that financially supports something.
meanings.sent1: The generous donors are the main sustainers of the charity's projects.
meanings.sent2: The sponsors are essential sustainers of the sports team.
meanings.sent3: The bake sale unexpectedly became the primary sustainer of the school fundraiser.
meanings.sent4: The investors are the financial sustainers of the startup company.
meanings.sent5: The loyal customers are the key sustainers of the local business.
